questions.question: 1. If you increase the quantum number n, what happens to the number of nodes in the wavefunction?

answers.b: The number of nodes remains the same
answers.d: The number of nodes becomes zero

questions.question: 2. What is the effect of changing the amplitude A on the wavefunction?

answers.a: It changes the frequency of the wavefunction
answers.b: It changes the shape of the wavefunction
answers.c: It changes the height of the wavefunction but not its shape
answers.d: It changes the time interval of the simulation

questions.question: 3. In an infinite potential well, where is the probability of finding the particle zero?

answers.b: At the boundaries of the well

explanations.b: In an infinite well, ψ = 0 at the walls (boundaries), so probability is zero there.

questions.question: 4. What happens to the energy spacing between levels as the quantum number n increases in an infinite potential well?

explanations.b: Energy levels follow n², so the gap between consecutive levels decreases for large n.

questions.question: 5. What determines the curvature of the wavefunction inside a potential well?

explanations.b: Curvature is related to kinetic energy and mass through the Schrödinger equation: higher energy → more curvature.
